system.description: Lenya is a CMS based on the XML publishing/application framework Cocoon from the Apache Software Foundation. Hence it is totally based on XML, XSLT and other related open standards. Lenya supports browser based inline WYSIWYG editors, such as Xopus, Bitflux and Epoz.

feature.title: WYSIWYG Editing
feature.description: Xopus, Bitflux Edior and Epoz have been integrated into Lenya.

feature.title: WYSIWYC areas
feature.description: Lenya differentiates between Admin, Authoring, Staging and Live area.

feature.title: Scheduler
feature.description: The Quatz scheduler has been integrated into Lenya

feature.title: Search
feature.description: Apache Lucene has been integrated into Lenya

feature.title: Authentication and Authorization Framework
feature.description: Access Control policies are being matched per request. Possible subjects are user, group, IP-number and "world". LDAP authentication has also been integrated.

feature.title: Multi-server deployment
feature.description: Lenya can be deployed across multiple servers, with each server being assigned capabilities - for example one server could be set up for Authoring and one for live deployment of the published site.
